message:
Hi! Love all of Bruno Paz extensions!

Currently sadly I am struggling with installing hawkeye. Running on Ubuntu 18.10

I have no experience with python but I thought I was able to install all required packages. E.g:

pip install markdown
Collecting markdown
Using cached https://files.pythonhosted....
Installing collected packages: markdown
Successfully installed markdown-3.0.1

If I try running hawkeye I get the following exception:

python3 main.py "https://www.google.com"
/Downloads/hawkeye/hawkeye/main_window.py:8: PyGIWarning: Gtk was imported without specifying a version first. Use gi.require_version('Gtk', '3.0') before import to ensure that the right version gets loaded.
from gi.repository import Gtk, Gdk, Gio
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "main.py", line 3, in <module>
from hawkeye.__main__ import *
File "/Downloads/hawkeye/hawkeye/__main__.py", line 7, in <module>
from hawkeye.main_window import MainWindow
File "/Downloads/hawkeye/hawkeye/main_window.py", line 11, in <module>
from hawkeye.viewer.markdown import MarkdownViewer
File "/Downloads/hawkeye/hawkeye/viewer/markdown.py", line 6, in <module>
from markdown import Markdown
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'markdown'

Does anybody know how I can make hawkeye work? Or is there any recommended alternative to use in cheats extension?

Any help much appreciated.
author: worufu

posts.message: Found the problem/solution: had to restart ulauncher afterwards. Now working fine.
posts.author: worufu
